alert.note: Alert for Bay (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 02 at 12:36PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Panhandle Florida, including the following county, Bay. * WHEN...Until 245 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1132 AM CST, Automated gauges have reported totals of 4 to 6 inches across the Panama City and Panama City Beach area. Law enforcement has reported minor flooding of roadways. The public has reported minor flooding in yards and parking lots via social media. Minor flooding is occurring. Light rain will continue across the advisory area, but for now the Flash Flood Warning will be allowed to expire and is replaced with this Flood Advisory. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Panama City, Lynn Haven, Panama City Beach, Callaway, Springfield, Hiland Park, Tyndall Air Force Base, Parker, Bay Harbor, Millville, Beacon Beach, Cedar Grove, Dirego Park, Brannonville, Magnolia Beach, College Station, St Andrews State Park, Biltmore Beach, Gulf Lagoon Beach and Allanton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
